III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4118 Social Service Supervisor; qualifications.
Section (1) A social service supervisor, at the time of appointment to the
Description position, shall possess either of the following:
(b) A bachelor’s degree in a human behavioral science or
another major with 25% of the credits in a human behavioral
science from an accredited college or university and 4 years of
experience as a social service worker.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility has a social service supervisor that does not qualify for the
position.
Investigation This complaint came through due to the facility requesting a
variance for Staff 1 to be the social services supervisor and
did not meet the years of employment experience. Within the
variance request, Staff 1’s resume was attached which noted
she was already the interim case manager supervisor prior to
the variance being requested.
Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on January 12, 2024. Staff 1
reported her current role at the facility is Interim Case Manager
Supervisor and was promoted to this role the beginning of
December 2023. She reported that currently her job functions are
to assist with case reviews, assist with their current audit the
facility is having, train new staff, and still maintain some of the
youth on her caseload. Staff 1 reported she is currently not signing
off on any reports or supervising any staff. She reported as an
interim supervisor she is just learning the role and stated that
there is a variance requested currently due to her years of
experience because she only has one year experience. Staff 1
reported she would not take over full supervisor responsibilities
until the variance was approved. She reported currently there are
three case manager supervisors at the facility and she would be
taking over is a supervisor that has been promoted to another role
that has not transitioned yet.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 16, 2024. Supervisor 1 reported that a supervisor
position at the facility opened in November 2023 and Staff 1 had
interviewed for the role. Due to the previous supervisor
transitioning there was some responsibilities that needed to be
taken over as soon as possible. Staff 1 was given the opportunity
to be in this Interim Case Manager Supervisor in December 2023.
Due to Staff 1’s experience level she was not able to take the role
2

officially because a variance needed to be approved. As an
Interim Case Manager Supervisor, Staff 1 does not supervise any
case managers or sign off on any reports. Her current role as
Interim Case Manager Supervisor is as follows: completing file
reviews, overseeing compliance of the case managers, assisting
with onboarding and training new case managers, reviewing case
submissions and providing feedback prior to official supervisor
sign off, assist the quality team with developing and maintaining
resources for case management team, attending meetings,
assisting in audits for clients files, reviewing home visit reports,
safety plans and USPS before official supervisor sign off.
Supervisor stated there are two Case Manager Supervisors
supervising the nine case managers at this time and Staff 1 is still
holds her own caseload of youth.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email dated 01/09/2024 from Supervisor 1 to Licensing
Consultant- Within this email, Supervisor 1 notified
Licensing Consultant that they wanted to move forward with
getting a variance for Staff 1 to move to the Case Manager
Supervisor role. Staff 1’s resume attached which noted she
was still a case manager.
- Emailed dated 01/11/2024 from Chief Administrator to
Licensing Consultant- Within this email, Chief
Administrator submitted a variance request to Licensing
Consultant for an exception for Staff 1 to be a Case
Manager Supervisor due to lack of work experience. This
email attached Staff 1’s resume that her current position
was Interim Case Manger Supervisor starting in December
2023.
- Staff 1’s Resume submitted on 01/11/2024- Staff 1’s
resume notes she was a case manager for the facility from
12/2022 to 12/2023. Staff 1’s resume reflects she became
the interim case manager supervisor in 12/2023 and is still
currently in that position. Staff 1’s resume shows only one
year of experience that would qualify under the social
services supervisor requirements per the CCI rules.
- Variance Request form dated 01/11/2024- This variance
request form was completed and submitted by Chief
Administrator dated 01/11/2024. This variance request form
requests a variance for the social services supervisor rule
for Staff 1.
- Breakdown of Case Manager Supervisors- Supervisor 1
showed this consultant a breakdown of the nine case
managers and their supervisors. Staff 1 reports to
Supervisor 1 and maintains a caseload. Supervisor 2 has
3

three case managers reporting to her. Supervisor 3 has five
case managers reporting to her.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has one job
description within her human resource file. This job
description is for the Transitional Foster Care Case
Manager and was signed by Staff 1 on 11/04/2022. This job
description does not allow Staff 1 to have the job
responsibilities as it notes for the supervisor role.
- Youth Reports dated 12/01/23 to 01/16/24- This
consultant reviewed all reports that case managers
completed during this time frame to review the signatures.
There are no supervisor signatures from Staff 1 within
these reports.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with this rule. Staff 1 was found
to not have the responsibility of supervising staff or signing off on
reports, which is the responsibility of the social services
supervisor.
Technical assistance
It is recommended the facility does not use the term “Interim Case
Manager Supervisor” as this can lead to confusion of the
responsibility of the staff and completing a role where they are
potentially not qualified to be in. It is suggestion that if a staff is in
transition of becoming a supervisor to promote the staff to a lead
worker while waiting for the final approval or training to become an
official supervisor.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
